intro: Lochnera, commonly known as the mountain bluet, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Caryophyllaceae. These plants are typically found in alpine and subalpine regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. They are characterized by their delicate, blue or purple flowers and linear leaves. Lochnera species are often found growing in rocky soils and open habitats. The genus includes several species, each adapted to high-altitude conditions with specialized structures for survival.
